newsitem.title: BRAZIL: El Nino keeps Brazil CS sugar areas hot - DataNet.
newsitem.headline: El Nino keeps Brazil CS sugar areas hot - DataNet.

text.p: The El Nino weather system is keeping temperatures high in Brazil's center-south sugar producing regions, independent consultants DataNet Agricommodities said in a regular bulletin.
Strong winds at high altitudes, intensified by El Nino, mean that cold fronts are hovering over the south of the country and sugar areas remain hot, DataNet said.
A cold front was due to hit the south on Aug 1, bringing heavy rains to the ports of Itajai in Santa Catarina and Paranagua in Parana and delaying the loading of sugar.

By Aug 2, the cold front could bring rain to the sugar cane regions in the south of Sao Paulo state and north of Parana and it should delay loading at Santos port. Rains should taper off by Aug 3-4 with isolated showers affecting Itajai port.
DataNet said the sugar cane had matured well, helped by the lack of rains over the last two months and cooler overnight temperatures.
Sugar content had also risen and was slightly above levels registered at the same time last year in most producing areas.
